description: Master ACCA AAA including Audit Planning, Complex Groups, Professional Ethics, and Reporting

slides.title: Welcome to ACCA AAA
slides.content:
# Advanced Audit and Assurance (AAA)

AAA covers **complex audit** scenarios and professional judgment.

## What You Will Learn

- **Planning** - Risk assessment
- **Complex Areas** - Groups, estimates
- **Ethics** - Professional judgment
- **Reporting** - Advanced opinions

## Syllabus Areas

| Area | Weight |
|------|--------|
| Ethics | 10% |
| Planning | 20% |
| Evidence | 30% |
| Evaluation | 20% |
| Reporting | 20% |

slides.content:

slides.title: Professional Ethics
slides.content:
# Ethical Framework

## Fundamental Principles

| Principle | Application |
|-----------|-------------|
| Integrity | Honest dealings |
| Objectivity | Unbiased judgment |
| Competence | Maintain skills |
| Confidentiality | Protect information |
| Behavior | Comply with law |

## Threats and Safeguards

| Threat | Safeguard |
|--------|----------|
| Self-interest | Withdraw |
| Self-review | Separate teams |
| Advocacy | Decline |
| Familiarity | Rotation |
| Intimidation | Report |

## Independence

- Of mind
- In appearance

slides.title: Quality Management
slides.content:
# Audit Quality

## ISQM 1

| Component | Focus |
|-----------|-------|
| Governance | Leadership responsibility |
| Ethics | Independence policies |
| Acceptance | Client evaluation |
| Engagement | Resourcing |
| Monitoring | Quality review |

## ISQM 2

Engagement quality reviews.

| When Required | Reason |
|---------------|--------|
| PIEs | Public interest |
| Complex | Significant risk |
| Policy | Firm decision |

## Hot Review

Before opinion issued.

slides.title: Audit Planning
slides.content:
# Planning Complex Audits

## Understanding Entity

| Area | Focus |
|------|-------|
| Industry | Sector risks |
| Operations | Business model |
| Controls | System design |
| Standards | Accounting policies |

## Risk Assessment

```
Audit Risk = IR x CR x DR

Assess inherent and control risks
Plan detection risk response
```

## Significant Risks

| Characteristic | Response |
|----------------|----------|
| Complex | Expert judgment |
| Judgment | Management bias |
| Fraud | Unpredictable |

## Materiality

- Overall materiality
- Performance materiality
- Specific items

slides.title: Group Audits
slides.content:
# Group Audit Considerations

## Responsibilities

| Role | Responsibility |
|------|---------------|
| Group auditor | Overall opinion |
| Component auditor | Work on components |

## Component Significance

| Significant | Response |
|-------------|----------|
| Financially | Full audit |
| Risk | Specified procedures |
| Not significant | Analytics |

## Communication

- Group instructions
- Component reports
- Access to papers

## Consolidation Issues

- Goodwill impairment
- Intra-group transactions
- Different reporting dates

slides.title: Audit Evidence
slides.content:
# Evidence Gathering

## Sufficient Appropriate Evidence

| Quality | Determinant |
|---------|------------|
| Relevance | To assertion |
| Reliability | Source/nature |

## Reliability Hierarchy

```
Most reliable:
1. External, directly obtained
2. Internal, strong controls
3. Internal, weak controls
4. Oral evidence
```

## Substantive Procedures

| Type | Purpose |
|------|--------|
| Tests of detail | Specific items |
| Analytics | Relationships |

## Sampling

- Statistical methods
- Professional judgment
- Extrapolation

slides.title: Evidence Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: Which evidence is generally most reliable?

slides.title: Accounting Estimates
slides.content:
# Auditing Estimates

## Risk Assessment

| Factor | Consideration |
|--------|---------------|
| Complexity | Model used |
| Judgment | Subjectivity |
| Uncertainty | Range of outcomes |

## ISA 540 Response

- Understand estimation process
- Evaluate appropriateness
- Test reasonableness
- Consider bias

## Common Estimates

| Estimate | Key Assumption |
|----------|----------------|
| Impairment | Future cash flows |
| Provisions | Probability/amount |
| Fair value | Inputs used |
| Pension | Actuarial assumptions |

## Management Bias

- Pattern of misstatement
- Optimistic assumptions
- Control override

slides.title: Related Parties
slides.content:
# Related Party Transactions

## Audit Risks

| Risk | Concern |
|------|--------|
| Undisclosed | Hidden relationships |
| Non-arm's length | Abnormal terms |
| Fraud | Concealment |

## Procedures

| Procedure | Purpose |
|-----------|--------|
| Enquiry | Identify parties |
| Review | Unusual transactions |
| Confirmation | Terms verification |

## Disclosure

- Nature of relationship
- Transaction amounts
- Outstanding balances

## Director Involvement

Higher fraud risk.

slides.title: Going Concern
slides.content:
# Going Concern Assessment

## Auditor Responsibilities

| Task | Requirement |
|------|------------|
| Evaluate | Management's assessment |
| Consider | 12 months from approval |
| Conclude | Appropriate use |

## Indicators

| Financial | Operational |
|-----------|------------|
| Net liabilities | Key staff loss |
| Negative cash | Supply issues |
| Loan defaults | Market loss |

## Reporting Impact

| Conclusion | Report |
|------------|--------|
| No concern | Unmodified |
| Material uncertainty | Emphasis of matter |
| Inappropriate | Adverse |

slides.title: Completion
slides.content:
# Audit Completion

## Procedures

| Task | Purpose |
|------|--------|
| Subsequent events | Post year-end |
| Representations | Management confirmations |
| Overall review | Stand back |
| Documentation | Complete file |

## Written Representations

- Mandatory items
- Specific matters
- Not substitute for evidence

## Evaluating Misstatements

```
Uncorrected misstatements:
- Evaluate individually
- Aggregate
- Consider qualitative
- Materiality impact
```

slides.title: Completion Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: Written representations can be used as a substitute for?

slides.title: Auditor's Report
slides.content:
# Reporting

## Report Structure

| Section | Content |
|---------|--------|
| Opinion | Clean or modified |
| Basis | Why that opinion |
| KAMs | Significant matters |
| Going concern | Assessment |
| Responsibilities | Management and auditor |

## Modified Opinions

| Type | When |
|------|------|
| Qualified | Material, not pervasive |
| Adverse | Material and pervasive (misstatement) |
| Disclaimer | Material and pervasive (limitation) |

## Key Audit Matters

- Most significant matters
- Professional judgment
- Listed entities
